label: FGS223
overview:
FIBARO Switch 2 is designed to be installed in standard wall switch boxes or anywhere else where it is necessary to control electric devices. FIBARO Switch 2 allows to control connected devices either via the Z-Wave+ network or via a switch connected directly to it and is equipped with active power and energy consumption metering functionality.

Main features of FIBARO Switch 2:

  • Compatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,
  • Supports protected mode (Z-Wave network security mode) with
  • AES-128 encryption,
  • Advanced microprocessor control,
  • Active power and energy metering functionality,
  • Works with various types of switches – momentary, toggle, three-way, etc,
  • To be installed in wall switch boxes of dimensions allowing for installation, conforming to provisions of applicable regulations,
  • FIBARO Switch 2 is an extension unit.
inclusion: Put controller into inclusion mode and triple click S1 switch
exclusion: Put controller into exclusion mode and triple click S1 switch

parameters.label: Restore state after power failure
parameters.description: Restore state after power failure
parameters.overview: This parameter determines if the device will return to state prior to the power failure after power is restored.

parameters.label: First channel operating mode
parameters.description: First channel - operating mode
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

NOTE
When parameter 10 value is set to 5, then parameter 11 value must be set to 0.

parameters.label: 1st ch. reaction to switch
parameters.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.

NOTE
When parameter 10 value is set to 5, then parameter 11 value must be set to 0.

options.label: cancel mode and set target state
no reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.description: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes.

Available settings: 0 (0.1s), 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - time parameter

Default setting: 50 (50s)

parameters.label: 1st ch. pulse time for flashing mode
parameters.description: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode

Available settings: 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step) - time parameter

Default setting: 5 (0.5s)

parameters.label: 2nd ch. operating mode
parameters.description: Second channel - operating mode
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S2 switch.

NOTE
When parameter 15 value is set to 5, then parameter 16 value must be set to 0.

parameters.label: 2nd ch. reaction to switch
parameters.description: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal.

NOTE
When parameter 15 value is set to 5, then parameter 16 value must be set to 0.

options.label: cancel mode and set target state
no reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: 2nd ch. time parameter for delay
parameters.description: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes.

Available settings: 0 (0.1s), 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - time parameter

Default setting: 50 (50s)

parameters.label: 2nd ch. pulse time for flashing mode
parameters.description: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode

Available settings: 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step) - time parameter

Default setting: 5 (0.5s)

parameters.label: Switch type
parameters.description: Switch type
parameters.overview: This parameter defines as what type the device should treat the switch connected to the S1 and S2 terminals

parameters.label: Flashing mode - reports
parameters.description: Flashing mode - reports

options.label: the device does not send reports

parameters.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameters.description: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st „Lifeline” group.

Available settings:

  • 1 - 2nd group sent as secure
  • 2 - 3rd group sent as secure
  • 4 - 4th group sent as secure
  • 8 - 5th group sent as secure

Parameter 27 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd groups are sent as secure.

parameters.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
parameters.description: S1 switch - scenes sent
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them.

Available settings:

  • 1 - Key pressed 1 time
  • 2 - Key pressed 2 times
  • 4 - Key pressed 3 times
  • 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released

Parameter 28 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent.

options.label: Key Hold Down and Key Released
In all cases a scene ID will be sent

parameters.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
parameters.description: S2 switch - scenes sent
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them.

Available settings:

  • 1 - Key pressed 1 time
  • 2 - Key pressed 2 times
  • 4 - Key pressed 3 times
  • 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released

Parameter 29 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent.

options.label: Key Hold Down and Key Released
In all cases a scene ID will be sent

parameters.label: S1 assocs. sent to 2nd and 3rd group
parameters.description: S1 switch - associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default.

Available settings:

  • 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch
  • 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch
  • 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch*
  • 8 - ignore double click of the switch**

Parameter 30 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations for turning On and OFF are not sent.

NOTE:
*Hold and release is inactive when parameter 20 is set to 1 or 2.
**Double click is inactive when parameter 20 is set to 1.

options.label: All actions are active by default
ignore turning ON with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

parameters.label: S1 ON val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameters.description: S1 switch - Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
NOTE:

Setting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:

0 - turning off associated devices

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices

255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: S1 OFF val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameters.description: S1 switch - Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

NOTE:

Setting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:

0 - turning off associated devices

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices

255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: S1 DblClick val sent to 2nd and 3rd groups
parameters.description: S1 switch - Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

NOTE:

Setting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:

0 - turning off associated devices

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices

255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: S2 assocs. sent to 4th and 5th group
parameters.description: S2 switch - associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending commands to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group. All actions are active by default.

Available settings:

  • 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch
  • 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch
  • 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch*
  • 8 - ignore double click of the switch**

Parameter 35 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations for turning On and OFF are not sent.

NOTE:

*Hold and release is inactive when param-eter 20 is set to 1 or 2.

**Double click is inac-tive when parameter 20 is set to 1.

options.label: All actions are active by default
ignore turning on with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning off with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

parameters.label: S2 ON val sent to 4th and 5th groups
parameters.description: S2 switch - Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch On command to devic-es associated in 4th and 5th association group.

NOTE:

Setting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:

0 - turning off associated devices

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices

255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.description: S2 switch - Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to de-vices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

NOTE:

Setting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:

0 - turning off associated devices

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices

255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: S2 DblClick val sent to 4th and 5th groups
parameters.description: S2 switch - Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to de-vices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

NOTE:

Setting parameters 31-33, 36-38 to appropriate value should result in:

1-99 - forcing level of associated devices

255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

parameters.label: Flashing alarm duration
parameters.description: Flashing alarm duration
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode.

Available settings: 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - duration

Default setting: 600 (10min)

parameters.label: First channel - power reports
parameters.description: First channel - power reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller.

Available settings:

  • 0 - reports are disabled
  • 1-100 (1-100%) - change in power

parameters.label: 1st ch min time between reports
parameters.description: First channel - minimal time between power reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller.

Available settings: 

0 - reports are disabled

1-120 (1-120s) - report interval

Default setting: 10 (10s)

parameters.label: 1st ch energy reports
parameters.description: First channel - energy reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before

sending new power report to the main controller.

Available settings:

0 - reports are disabled

1-32000 (0.01 - 320 kWh) - change in energy

Default: 100 (1 KWh)

parameters.label: Second channel - power reports
parameters.description: Second channel - power reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller.

Available settings:

  • 0 - reports are disabled
  • 1-100 (1-100%) - change in power

parameters.label: 2nd ch min time between reports
parameters.description: Second channel - minimal time between power reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller.

Available settings:

0 - periodic reports are disabled

1-120 (1-120s) - report interval

Default setting: 10 (10s)

parameters.label: 2nd ch energy reports
parameters.description: Second channel - energy reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller.

Available settings:

0 - reports are disabled

1-32000 (0.01 - 320 kWh) - change in energy

Default setting: 100 (1 KWh)

parameters.label: Periodic power reports
parameters.description: Periodic power reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller.

Available settings: 

0 - periodic reports are disabled

1-32000 (1-32000s) - report interval

Default setting: 3600 (1h)

parameters.label: Periodic energy reports
parameters.description: Periodic energy reports
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic energy reports are sent to the main controller.

Available settings:

0 - periodic reports are disabled

1-32000 (1-32000s) - report interval

Default setting: 3600 (1h)

parameters.label: Include own energy
parameters.description: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
parameters.overview: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).
associations.overview: 1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).

associations.label: On/Off (S1)
associations.description: On/Off (S1) is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Basic command class)
associations.overview: 2nd association group – “On/Off (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: Dimmer (S1)
associations.description: “Dimmer (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)
associations.overview: “Dimmer (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)

associations.label: On/Off (S2)
associations.description: On/Off (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Basic command class)
associations.overview: On/Off (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Basic command class)

associations.label: Dimmer (S2)
associations.description: Dimmer (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)
associations.overview: Dimmer (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)
